author: Paul J. Davies
title: Why Banks Will Cheer CME Snapping Up NEX
text:
Companies that run financial plumbing are doing their best to improve the flow of global liquidity. Bank executives will thus have high hopes for the latest takeover between exchanges.

CME Group’s $5.4 billion, £10-a-share offer for Michael Spencer’s electronic trading platform NEX Group is an eye-popping 60% ahead of the U.K.-listed target’s average over three months before news of the deal talks earlier in March. This values NEX at nearly 29-times forecast earnings, high but not so far ahead of CME’s own 24.4-times valuation....
